qas.question: When was the Treaty of Kyakhta written?
Who was the partner in the Treaty of Kyakhta?
What did the treaty give to the Russians?
What did the Qing get from the Treaty of Kyakhta?

context: Yongzheng also inherited diplomatic and strategic problems. A team made up entirely of Manchus drew up the Treaty of Kyakhta (<a0_0>1727<a0_0/>) to solidify the diplomatic understanding with <a1_0>Russia<a1_0/>. In exchange for <a2_0>territory and trading rights<a2_0/>, the Qing would have a free hand dealing with the situation in <a3_0>Mongolia<a3_0/>. Yongzheng then turned to that situation, where the Zunghars threatened to re-emerge, and to the southwest, where local Miao chieftains resisted Qing expansion. These campaigns drained the treasury but established the emperor's control of the military and military finance.
